data.title: Israeli military claims first strikes against targets in central Iranian capital.
data.description: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) announced on March 1 that it had conducted its first strikes against Iranian regime targets in central Tehran. Several loud explosions were heard in Tehran, and plumes of smoke were seen rising. The IDF stated that the Israeli Air Force, guided by intelligence, had begun strikes against Iranian regime targets in Tehran. This marks the first time the IDF has struck targets in central Tehran during its current military operation against Iran. (Xinhua)

data.title: Chinese Airlines Offer Refunds Amid Middle East Instability
data.description: Chinese airlines have begun offering refunds to passengers with tickets to certain Middle East destinations due to increasing instability in the region. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the travel disruptions caused by the situation. The decision comes as tensions escalate, impacting travel plans and prompting airlines to address passenger concerns. This move aims to mitigate the inconvenience faced by travelers amid the ongoing regional unrest.

data.title: X Platform's Paid Partnership Policy Update: Cryptocurrencies, Investment Services, etc., are no longer eligible for promotion.
data.description: According to X platform's updated paid partnership policy, financial products, services, or opportunities (including loans, investment services, cryptocurrencies, buy-now-pay-later services, and other finance-related content) are now prohibited from paid promotion. Furthermore, the policy requires all paid partnership content to clearly indicate its commercial nature in the post, such as "advertisement" or "promotional content," and to ensure compliance with all applicable laws and regulations. Users who violate this policy may face penalties such as post deletion or account suspension.

data.title: Gulf states have been attacked for the second consecutive day, and Iran's internet has been cut off for more than 24 hours.
data.description: Israel and the United States launched military strikes against multiple locations in Iran. Iran retaliated by striking Israeli and US military bases in the Middle East, including those in the UAE and Qatar. This morning (March 1st) local time, explosions were heard again in Dubai, UAE, and Doha, Qatar. According to the internet monitoring agency NetBlocks, Iran's internet has been down for over 24 hours. (Jinshi)

data.title: Whale Address Closes BTC Long Position with Significant Profit
data.description: On March 1, a whale address known as 'pension-usdt.eth' has closed its long position in Bitcoin, according to BlockBeats On-chain Detection. The transaction resulted in a profit of approximately $466,000.

data.title: Ethereum's Q1 return is currently -32.17%, and Bitcoin's is currently -23.21%.
data.description: According to Coinglass data, Bitcoin's Q1 2026 return is currently -23.21%, the third lowest quarterly return since 2013, far below the historical Q1 average of 45.90%. Furthermore, Ethereum's Q1 2026 return is currently -32.17%, the third lowest since 2016, far below the historical Q1 average of 66.45% and the median return of 4.37%.

data.title: Communities Seek Safety Amid Ongoing Challenges
data.description: Communities across various regions are facing significant challenges, prompting widespread concern and support. YZi Labs posted on X, expressing solidarity with those affected and emphasizing the collective hope for a quicker resolution to ensure safety and peace for all involved. The situation continues to evolve, with many looking towards a future where stability is restored.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Internet Disruption in Iran Exceeds 24 Hours
data.description: Internet monitoring organization NetBlocks reports that Iran has experienced an internet outage lasting over 24 hours. According to Jin10, this disruption has raised concerns about communication and information flow within the country. The prolonged outage has affected various sectors, highlighting the vulnerability of digital infrastructure in times of political or social unrest. The reasons behind the internet shutdown remain unclear, but it underscores the challenges faced by citizens and businesses reliant on digital connectivity. Observers are closely monitoring the situation as it unfolds.

data.title: Shiba Inu's Price Decline Presents Buying Opportunity
data.description: Shiba Inu (SHIB), which saw a significant surge in 2021, has now decreased by more than 90% from its peak. According to NS3.AI, the current low prices present an opportunity for both new and existing investors to reduce their average costs and prepare for a potential recovery. To successfully invest in SHIB, it is crucial to purchase during price dips and maintain a disciplined exit strategy to benefit from future bullish trends.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Protests in Karachi Lead to Fatalities Following Khamenei's Assassination
data.description: At least nine people have died in Karachi, Pakistan, amid protests triggered by the assassination of Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. According to Jin10, the unrest has escalated as demonstrators express outrage over the incident. The situation remains tense, with authorities urging calm and deploying additional security forces to manage the protests. The impact of these events is being closely monitored by international observers, given the potential implications for regional stability.

data.title: Middle East Conflict Raises Concerns Over Travel Insurance Coverage
data.description: The recent airstrikes by the United States and Israel on Iran have led to escalating conflicts in several Middle Eastern countries. According to Ming Pao, this situation has raised concerns among Hong Kong travelers who often transit through Dubai and Doha on Emirates or Qatar Airways flights to Europe and Africa. The insurance comparison platform 10Life highlighted in a blog post that most travel insurance policies include coverage for 'airport closures' under 'trip delay' benefits, typically activated after a delay of five to six hours. However, 10Life pointed out that unlike cancellation coverage, most delay clauses do not explicitly exempt war-related incidents. This means that insurance companies could potentially deny claims if the delay is due to military conflict. 10Life urges insurance companies to clarify their stance on this issue promptly.

data.title: On-chain NFT transactions related to Bitcoin have shrunk dramatically, with February sales falling below $25 million, marking the lowest level since March 2023.
data.description: According to CryptoSlam data, Bitcoin on-chain NFT sales plummeted to approximately $24,448,223 in February 2026, marking the lowest monthly sales figure since March 2023. On-chain Bitcoin NFT transactions decreased to approximately 50,854, with 10,048 unique buyer addresses and 10,510 unique seller addresses. Conversely, Ethereum on-chain NFT sales rebounded in February, exceeding $200 million, reaching a new monthly sales high since November 2025. On-chain NFT transactions reached 152,632, with 21,729 unique buyer addresses and 21,487 unique seller addresses.

data.title: Data: Polymarket platform generates $600 million in contracts related to the US-Iran conflict.
data.description: Following the US-Israel airstrikes against Iran, the decentralized prediction market platform Polymarket quickly launched over ten event contracts related to the situation in Iran, covering topics such as the ceasefire period, the successor to the Supreme Leader, and whether US troops would enter Iran. Since the attacks, the market has attracted approximately $600 million in trading volume. Among them, the contract for the event "Will Khamenei lose his position as Iran's Supreme Leader before March 31?" was 100% settled after Iranian state television confirmed his death, with a trading volume of $45 million. The biggest winner, the account "Curseaaaaaaa," profited approximately $757,000 through a "Yes" position, and four other traders profited over six figures. Furthermore, the largest single event contract is the contract for the event "When will the US launch airstrikes against Iran?", which has accumulated a trading volume of $529 million since its launch on December 22 last year, with a single-day trading volume of $89.6 million on February 28. Subsequent market activity showed that traders were generally betting on a phased resolution to the conflict within weeks: the probability of a ceasefire between the US and Iran was only 4% before March 2nd, 15% before March 6th, but rose to 61% before March 31st, and reached 78% before April 30th. (CoinDesk)

data.title: Ukraine Negotiator Claims Russian Agreement on U.S. Security Assurances
data.description: Ukraine's presidential office chief and negotiation team member, Budanov, stated in a conversation with reporters that Russia has agreed to the security assurance terms provided by the United States to Ukraine. According to Jin10, Budanov mentioned that during previous negotiations, Russia explicitly supported the U.S. security assurances for Ukraine. He also noted that all parties are currently seeking 'compromise' regarding territorial issues. However, Russia has not yet confirmed this information.

data.title: AurumX ecosystem infrastructure manadia completes $7 million seed funding round
data.description: Manadia, a Web3 verifiable data and AI collaboration infrastructure, has officially announced the completion of a $7 million seed round of financing. Investors include OKX Ventures, Pillar VC, One Way Ventures, Quasar Holding Co., and Sandeep Nailwal, co-founder of Polygon, also participated in this round. Incubated by AurumX-backed AUR Labs in collaboration with leading global institutions, the project focuses on the underlying infrastructure for low-trust-dependent data settlement and AI collaboration. It provides core capabilities such as the VERITAS verifiable oracle, AI Agent collaboration, privacy-preserving settlement, and compliant payments, offering secure and reliable value exchange and cross-system collaboration support for the financial, digital asset, and AI ecosystems. Manadia stated that it will continue to promote technology implementation and ecosystem expansion, striving to make every digital collaboration safer, more verifiable, and more efficient, becoming a key underlying support for the entire financial and AI ecosystem.

data.title: The whale "pension-usdt.eth" closed its long Bitcoin position, making a profit of $466,000.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens monitoring, the whale "pension-usdt.eth" closed its long Bitcoin positions, making a profit of $466,000.

data.title: Global PMI Surveys and U.S. Payrolls Set to Influence Markets
data.description:
Global markets are poised for a significant week as investors focus on key economic indicators. S&P Global PMI posted on X, highlighting the importance of these surveys in assessing economic health. The upcoming U.S. payrolls report is also expected to provide crucial insights into the labor market, influencing market sentiment and potential policy decisions.

The PMI surveys will offer a snapshot of manufacturing and service sector performance across various regions, providing valuable data on economic activity and growth prospects. Analysts will closely monitor these figures to gauge the strength of the global economy and identify potential trends.

Meanwhile, the U.S. payrolls report will be a focal point for investors, as it reflects employment changes and wage growth. This data is critical for understanding the labor market's recovery and its impact on consumer spending and inflation.

Market participants will analyze these reports to adjust their strategies and anticipate any shifts in monetary policy. The outcomes of these economic indicators could have significant implications for financial markets worldwide.

data.title: Cryptocurrency Traders Seek Market Bottom Amid Modest Recovery
data.description: Cryptocurrency traders are closely monitoring the market for signs of a bottom following a slight recovery on Sunday. Bloomberg posted on X that this uptick came after Iran confirmed the death of its supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. The news has prompted traders to assess the potential impact on the cryptocurrency market, as geopolitical events often influence investor sentiment and market dynamics. The recent developments have added a layer of uncertainty, leading market participants to remain vigilant in their analysis of price movements.

source: https://cryptonews.com/news/us-judge-lets-binance-unregistered-token-class-action-proceed/

data.title: Elon Musk's Social Media Exchange Highlights Geopolitical Tensions
data.description: Elon Musk recently revisited a past social media exchange with Iran's late Supreme Leader Khamenei, reigniting discussions on geopolitical tensions. According to NS3.AI, the original interaction featured Khamenei asserting resistance against adversaries, to which Musk responded by calling it a 'ridiculous fantasy.' While this exchange underscores ongoing geopolitical issues, it does not directly influence the cryptocurrency market.
